intro: Scrophularia jafrii, commonly known as the Kashmir wallflower, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals arranged in a bilateral symmetry. Scrophularia jafrii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
